intro: Schoenoplectiella monocephala, commonly known as the single-headed bulrush, is a wetland plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, often in marshes and along the edges of lakes and ponds. Its slender, triangular stems are often topped with a single, small flowering head. The species is notable for its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various aquatic organisms.
